result.execSummary:
The defendant Romeao Marquis Cavitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

AODA comply with any request.
DNA Sample if not already taken.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Romeao Marquis Cavitt in court & in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:04 pm.  Plea advisement filed. State gives plea agreement, plea to charge, 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs initial confinement, 2 yrs extended supervision, consecutive, stayed 3 years probation  AODA & follow counseling as deemed app, costs. Atty Laufenberg agrees, Def. agrees. Poss of Narcotic drugs, repeater, Guilty plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. advised of voting rights & firearm rights. Def. advised of DNA sample.  Atty Laufenberg is satisfied. Court orders clerk to enter plea.  Stipulate to complaint.  Court finds factual basis, & finds def. convicted. Parties agree to plea agreement.  Atty Laufenberg gives statement. Court goes a long with plea agreement, 
4 yrs prison, 2 years initial confinement, 2 yrs extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, stay,  3 yrs probation, AODA comply with any request, costs, DNA sample if not already taken. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Romeao Marquis Cavitt in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Romeao Marquis Cavitt in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def to waive right to preliminary hearing.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Court explains right to preliminary.  Def waives right, written waiver signed.  Court accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Reserve jurisdicational objections.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accept not guilty pleas.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:37 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Romeao Marquis Cavitt in court via video with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Romeao Marquis Cavitt in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Special appearance by Atty Nocco.  Complaint received, reviewed, waive reading.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
